Hiléia Karla Silva de Souza

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/9674613502422472
  • Última atualização do currículo em 10/07/2013

Actually I am a Post-Doctoral Researcher at the Chemical Engineering Department of the Faculty of Engineering at the University of Porto. I received my PhD by the Chemistry Department of the Science Faculty at the University of Porto, in July 2007 on the topic of Calorimetric studies of DNA interactions with transition metal ions in solution. I also worked several years at UFRN [Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte-Brazil] were I got my MSc and graduate degree. My research interests are centered on the study of certain biomolecules with interest for the food and cosmetic industry. In my career I have been trained in the use of different calorimetric (ITC,DSC,TG), rheological and biophysical techniques(eg.: CD, flurescence and so on). During my PhD, the nature of the interactions of the metal ions with DNA molecule was studied with the purpose of the development of a better understanding of biological process and the evaluation involved on the conformational changes of nucleic acids in the presence of divalent metal ions. Later, during my post-doctoral positions, I successfully employed the characterization of soluble/coacervate complexes formed between whey proteins (WP) and chitosan to study the implication of the soluble complexes in the formation of protein aggregates and the application of the coacervates in the microencapsulation of bioactive substance. I also have been worked in the characterization of short chain sonicated chitosan polyelectrolites, their interaction with WP and their use in the preparation of biofilms. Recently, I studied the formation of soluble/insoluble complexes between WP and Microwave-assisted extraction (MAE) agars. Also, I have collaborated in the study of the interaction between WP and chitosan-modified surfaces. (Texto informado pelo autor)
